data.title: Dinner before a concert
data.text: Stopped in to get dinner and a few drinks before a concert. Food was good, the atmosphere is not "casual" dining. Everyone in our party enjoyed their dish, service is good and food came out in a good amount of time considering it was really busy.

data.title: Quick Stop Before a Wedding
data.text: Stopped in with 10 people between pictures and the start of a wedding. Only ones there from 2 to 2:45, 3 waitresses. Drinks were spot on (mine was an absolutely great maragarita) and a few snacks with warm salsa chips. Food was excellent as were the drinks and the service. We were visiting for the wedding, otherwise I would have eaten a dinner there. What a great surprise!

data.title: Delicious!!!
data.text: Food is absolutely delicious EVERY TIME I have gone!!  Steaks are cooked to the perfection of your choice, and literally melts in your mouth!  I have tried a different meal/plate every time I've eaten there and everything was delicious!!  Will definitely be back again!!

data.title: lunch buffet really good
data.text: I really liked this place since the first day I went for their lunch buffet. Specially when the weeks "feature" is prime rib steak. Also their pork belly tacos are included in the buffet. Pork belly is like carnitas but with more flavor so im pretty sure you will enjoy them. There isn't alot of variety but what they have is pretty good. They also have good service. Waitresses are always nice. Keep in mind though this restaurant doesn't have parking. You'll have to park across the street in a parking garage.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Gotta say its good. . I gave it 3 instead of 5 solely because i wasn't offered any wine.  It's the little things right?   No the truth is its a nice place, nice environment and good food.  Staff, kind and friendly.  I must admit, i didn't order off the menu but instead had the lunch buffet on a Monday.  Not busy so the turn over rate wasn't as fast and in turn cold green enchiladas.  Which by the way had a good taste ( even cold ). Chile verde lasagna didn't do it for me.  Let's keep that Italian please.  Red enchiladas, chicken fajitas,  and the rest of food was decent.  But those chicken tacos work the guacamole with no pico, where superb!

data.title: Different Sunday Brunch
data.text: First time in for a Sunday brunch.  Saw the Bloody Mary bar but had heard about the great mixed drinks made from scratch (no bottled mix)....so tried the Cucumber Margarita with jalapeno, and it was VERY good.  Think we may have been a little late to begin the buffet (12:40PM), since it closes at 2PM.  Most food on the main buffet was replenished. The wait staff didn't explain the buffet process, or point out just where the different food items were located (we had to ask and just observed), but some guidance would have been helpful. Also didn't describe what would be coming out from the kitchen (the meat selections on skewers).  The meat was absolutely delicious, but they were very slow between choices, and there was certainly not enough meat on each skewer to satisfy all the tables in the restaurant.  I had to ask for the lamb, but when it came (very late in the meal), it was delicious.  Missed out on some of the better deserts, which were located away from out table right next to the entrance near a window.  Had I not asked for the desert location, we'd never found it since it was not visible from our table.  The mimosas were good, according to my husband, and they came by to resupply the drinks quite frequently.  Our server was MIA some times, and we had to flag down some other server to get things like water, new silverware, etc.  Want to try it out for a lunch or dinner just to see how the regular menu stacks up against their brunch menu.  I might go back again for the brunch, but certainly wouldn't take out of town guests unless they were pretty laid back.

data.title: SLOW
data.text: My husband and I walked in for lunch at 1215. The place was full but not packed. We did not get the buffet and ordered off the menu. The waitstaff was attentive but it took fifty minutes to get one a la carter taco and enchiladas. They were good but not great. Also people were served that arrived after we did. To add insult to injury the wrong ticket was charged and we had to wait ten minutes to get that resolved. Second time I have had this experience. Maybe a good place for drinks or dinner but forget lunch. Others were also complained.

data.title: Brunch this time
data.text: Not a cheap brunch, for sure. My husband and I decided to make sure we ate the expensive stuff, so it was the seafood and the Brazilian style meats. We never made it over to all the side stuff that goes with this brunch, but saw most people did. Everyone must have thought we were crazy that we didn't leave the table just kept waiting for all the meats. Filet Mignons melted in your mouth, the lamb chops were excellent too. All the meats were good, chicken wrapped in bacon, dry. When they came around with sausages we both passed on those. All the side stuff I'm sure was very good, beans, rice, enchiladas, omelet bar, salads chips ect ect. Service was unbeatable, everyone there constantly checking on you, oh and endless momosa's.

data.title: Amazing meats
data.text:
We were amazed by the meats and seafood served at this Sunday Brunch.  They had the traditional brunch fare for a Latin American restaurant, but our server advised to skip the beans, rice, enchiladas eggs and omelets. Instead she recommended we focus on the seafood and the meat served table side. The sea food was very good and included shrimp, mussels, clams, oysters and smoked salmon. But the table side meats were just outstanding. The servers walked around with skewers of various meat fresh out of the kitchen. They had Lamb chops, filet mignon, ribeye steak, skirt steak, chicken wings, and others. Each item was seasoned and cooked to perfection. The servers were always nearby to take care of anything you wanted. The brunch included Mimosas, Bloody Marys any other nonalcoholic beverage you might want. Although it was expensive this is the best Brunch we have had in Bakersfield and better than most other Brunches anywhere. 
We will definitely go again once we have digested all the food we ate and it fits in our budget.

data.title: Hair in food!
data.text: My husband and I decided to try Centro 18 for dinner. Our grand daughter and daughter from San Diego were visiting and we wanted to treat them to a nice dinner. We order chicken enchiladas, grilled asparagus, burrito and some Spanish rice for my grand daughter. The two stars are be a use yes, they are prepared with coloring pages and crayons for kids and kiddie drink cups. I appreciated that. Well it was 40 minutes till the food was served. I thought it would be great and made from scratch. The garlic fries were the only hot item on the plate. The asparagus were not grilled but just sautéed a bit. They were hard as a rock and not warm nor hot. The enchiladas were cold and the cheese barely melted. My daughter's burrito dinner had hair in it! And the rice for my grand daughter was sticky and cool. We called the waitress over after several attempts to get their attention. They offered to redo the burrito. They explained that the enchiladas were straight out of the microwave and should be hot. We asked for the check and declined them to redo the burrito. Then waited 10 minutes for the check. Yes, the deducted the burrito, but I paid for the rest. It is only right as we had taken a couple bites. Horrible service, inattention to customer satisfaction, and just made us feel like we were a bother. Oddly the place was full and has a 4.8/5 rating. I don't get it. Needless to say, it ruined the night/visit for us. By the time we got out of there  it was too late to look for another place. Very disappointed!!!

data.title: Cuisine & Lounge excellent meal
data.text:
I just got home from a delicious meal from Cuisine18 and want to review while I have the exceptional tastes in my mouth. When I first saw the menu and the prices, I thought "no way will I pay that. I'll order something cheap" as I had to be there for a friend's birthday. BUT when I got there, I decided to order the fajitas as Christian, my wonderful waiter, said it was his second favorite meal there (his first was the rib eye steak, as was the female waitress/bartender).  
There is no way to describe the meal other than there was so much I was able to take some home for tomorrow's meal. The vegetables were as tasty as I have ever had, and the chicken was cooked to perfection.(Shrimp or steak is available for the fajitas). We were first served chips and pico gallo dip,not sure of the name) which allowed us time to visit and talk. Others at the table ordered the Caldo de Rez stew/soup, grilled chicken salad, a Burrito and none were disappointed. 
I'm told there is a lunch buffet during the week for $12. I will try that soon, to taste other foods served.   
Our waiter, Christian, went above and beyond his duties, in taking care of 9 women. We kept him busy with more water, tortillas and chip refills, and his kindness never faltered. There is a tip suggestion on the receipt,but I left a bit more because he was exceptional. 
Will I go back? Yes, to try the Pork Belly Taco and the Caldo de Raz soup.

data.title: OMG!
data.text: Sat down at 7:01- not something I would normally track but I received a text as we were seated. Most tables were occupied so my friend and I ate at the bar. It seemed more of a  bar you would find at a frat house which included a guy passed out- head down on the bar, numerous dirty glasses on the bar, and more. We ordered food and drink at about 7:25. I was asked which two sides I wanted with my burrito- I ordered all veggies and I asked the waitress for no rice on my burrito. We waited patiently for about 20 minutes for our drink before we were able to get the attention of the bartender  (our waitress had not placed our order yet). Our waitress came back at about the same time as we received our drinks to ask me if I had ordered the steak burrito. I said yes and reminded her no rice. About 10/15 minutes later our waitress came to ask me if I wanted green or red sauce. I like the red sauce and ordered it. A few minutes later our dinner was served. Actually,  the food was very good. We ate, waited a while for our check and discovered three  discussion points once it was brought.  Our bill showed a charge for a glass of wine we didn't order, three bucks for the vegetables (well, you ordered the vegetables). I didn't broach the dollar charge for the red sauce. We finally left at 8:36. Needless to say, I was not expecting a 90 minute dinner.

data.title: Unlimited mimosas and hot meat on skewers at brunch? Sign me up....
data.text: Probably one of the best brunches in Bakersfield. The girls (4 of us in our 50's) and I decided to treat ourselves to a morning out. We picked Centro 18 on a whim. None of us had every been there before. We walked into the nicely decorated room at 11 and were greeted by a vocalist singing standards and soft pop. Nice touch. We were seated promptly and offered drinks and an explanation of what was available. The brunch included seafood (fresh oysters, smoked salmon and a really good ceviche), cold prepared salad offerings, a full hot bar of Mexican specialties and at the front of the restaurant a small but nicely prepared dessert table. The highlight of the meal was the waiters that brought hot, fresh meat selections to the table similar to a Brazilian  steakhouse. The skirt steak, filet and tri tip were delicious. They also offered chicken, pork and sausage. Service was prompt and attentive. Needless to say we left about 2 hours later. Good friends, good food, good conversation...it doesn't get any better....

data.title: Good Eats
data.text: 1st time being here and it was a good choice from the friends we met there. Our friends have been here before and they really enjoy the place, which we did too. We started with the Ceviche de Trio, excellent and the Queso Fundido, even better, appetizers. Plenty for all 4 of us, and very good choices. Along with the Margaritas we were filling pretty good. The girls ordered the taco plate, which are very small tacos, which was good because we weren't too hungry after the appetizers. My husband got the Enchiladas Rojas o Verdes with beef, wasw tons of beef and not much cheese, I believe it needed more cheese, was still good though. The other order was the Chili Relleno which looked really good and our friend said tasted really good too. Would recommend this place to anyone and will be back. The brunch sounds wonderful, really want to try it.

data.title: Wonderful surprise
data.text:
We were traveling through Bakersfield after a camping trip and stopped by Centro 18 in hopes of getting a table without reservations on Father's Day. Amazingly we got there just after another reservation had been canceled so they were able to seat 6 of us plus a baby. 
The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly.. The entire experience was wonderful. The buffet was excellent with authentic menudo and an omelette bar. Save room for desert! I wish I could have eaten more. I will definitely return here next time I pass through town.

data.title: Latin Food with Flair
data.text: While I have only visited this restaurant once, I will be back.  I ordered the seafood fajitas.  OUTSTANDING!!  Salmon, shrimp and scallops. The scallops were cooked perfectly!  Not everyone can cook scallops - Kudos to the Chef!!

data.title: Best food in town!!
data.text: They food is delicious!!  Any steak you order is actually cooked to your liking!  I always end up with a steak that is cooked too much, no matter how much I tell them exactly how I like it.  I've ordered different steaks each time I go and have ALWAYS gotten it exactly the way I like it.  Each plate I've ordered has been delicious, and their sides are all SOOO good.  Definitely worth every penny spent.  The atmosphere is nice, elegant, and the waiters/waitresses are all very helpful and there to serve you.  We've gone back many times, and each time has been a great experience.  They have a Sunday Brunch to die for, where they bring different types of meat to taste. Monday night sushi nights.  So good, we keep going back!!

data.title: DELICIOUS!!!!!
data.text: Walking distance from the Padre Hotel.  The pork belly tacos are AMAZING!!!!  I'm from LA and I want to drive back just for the tacos.  The flan is one of the best that I've ever had.

data.title: Excellent food; somewhat dodgy service
data.text:
This was our first visit to this new spot in town. We had heard only good things and those comments proved true. The menu leans to Mexican food with some South American and Puerto Rican influences. I started with a very good house margarita to accompany freshly made chips and an excellent salsa. I had pork enchiladas and throughly enjoyed the most tender pork I've ever had. This dish can be served with a red or green sauce. I chose to have one enchilada with the red sauce and one with the green. Both were very good, though a little too sparse for my liking. My wife had the arrachera con chimichurri - a perfectly prepared (medium rare) strip steak. The chimichurri was excellent. The accompanying jalapeño potatoes and grilled vegetables were just right.

The ambiance here is pleasant but not particularly noteworthy. The only thing that kept this visit from getting a fifth star was the service. Our server was very friendly but he seemed overextended. He was constantly on the move but had too many tables to cover. The salsa was served several minutes before the chips, both of which were delayed. My wife's drink was served several minutes before mine. I was asked if I wanted a second drink, but she was never asked. The meal was so good that the service issues didn't detract from our enjoyment of the evening.

Bottom line: we'll certainly go back.

data.title: Good new restaurant down town
data.text: A great new place that I hope makes it through its infancy. Visited for lunch and enjoyed a good meal. I would recommend this location for good food and service. Nice linen table cloths ad an upscale ambiance to a building that has housed a few eating establishments over the last few years. Good quality food with a nice special touch on Mexican cuisine. Service was spot on .
